newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends unchanged ahead of US elections.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends unchanged ahead of US elections.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed unchanged against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, as investors stepped to the sidelines to await results of the U.S. presidential and congressional elections, dealers said.
The local unit ended at T$27.501, the same as Monday's close. Turnover through dealers was a modest US$166 million.
"Investors have adopted a wait-and-see attitude before the U.S. elections," said one dealer.
"Also, the Taiwan dollar is in a situation that is insensitive to most factors now that it has cooled down after its sharp recent falls," he said.

The Taiwan dollar had dipped as low as T$27.620 in intraday trade in late October, but has rebounded in that past week. In theory, the dealer said, the Taiwan dollar still has room for a depreciation because of a low Taiwan dollar interbank rate and a firming U.S. dollar overseas. But it has moved little.
"Both investors and banks alike recently seem to have had little interest in trading," he said.
For Wednesday, a T$27.48-27.52 range was seen.
